result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.   Clerk: EZ.  (15CM41 and 15CM131; 15CM973 Br. 1;  15CM1103 Br. 2)  State indicates the victim requests to be present and due to the quick turn around in scheduling the victim was not notified.  Court takes a recess to make contact with the victim.  Reconvene.  State advises the victim does not wish to be present for sentencing and can feel free to proceed today.  Court dismissed case upon plea to 15CM1103.
Per request of Atty Borkowicz, case set for hearing in Br 1 on Aug 1, 2017 at 9:30 am for global resolution with case 15CM973.
Hearing on August 17, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State. Counsel's first appearance, was just appointed last week and needs to gather additional information.   LAST ADJOURNMENT  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Mot. & Demand for Discovery and Inspection; Motion signed; Demand unsigned

Maintain absolute sobriety; Not possess or consume controlled substances without valid prescription; Take all medications as prescribed and only as prescribed; No contact with SC or his residence on Hillside Rd, Town of Polk; Def refused to sign bond
Hearing on July 26, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Matthew Edward Weil.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.   Clerk: EZ.  (15CM41, 15CM131 & 15CM973 Br. 1;  15CM1103 Br. 2) Atty. deJunco advises the defendant has been reevaluated and Atty. Matthew Weil will be reappointed.   State request $5,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. deJunco states defendant could reside with his father and defendant wishes to address the court.  Defendant makes statements.  Defendant states missed court as had no place to stay and left the state for a period of time and request to resolve the matters.  Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for July 26, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Atty Matthew Edward Weil appearing for Def.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.  Counsel does not know why def is not present; Sheriff's Dept rec'd information that def may be out of state.  Court issues warrant and orders bail forfeiture.  Jury trial set 5-2-16 removed from calendar.

Atty Matthew Edward Weil appearing for Def.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ. (15CM41, 15CM131 & 15CM973 Br. 1;  15CM1103 Br. 2)  Case called at 10:12 a.m.  State request capias.  Counsel has no explanation for non-appearance and had contact with defendant earlier in the week and anticipated a global resolution.  Matter remains as scheduled in Branch 4 on April 13, 2016.

Defendant provided w/ slip for SPD and shall contact them no later than 12/18/2015.
